line_2: Wham I left in his prime,
Your hearts will feel like mine;

line_1: But aye they look back to the days o' langsyne.
line_2: The drum it was beating, to fight they incline,

line_1: Could William but lead, and I fight, as langsyne.
line_2: Yet I'd venture, fu' cheerfu', this auld trunk o' mine,

line_1: Youth winna return, nor the strength o' langsyne.
line_2: And tho' at the change we should sadly repine,

line_1: And will follow us yet for the sake o' langsyne.
line_2: E'en now they're resolv'd baith their hames to resign,
